Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Cookie Compliance] Revert revert and fix the functional test" (#8236) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "NuGet is not connected to the Internet." (#8237) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1204423/nugetÊó†Ê≥ïËÅîÁΩë.html)._ --- NuGet is not connected to the Internet. The nuget.org index of the source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json could not be loaded. There was an error sending the request. The underlying connection is closed: The trust relationship could not be established for the SSL/TLS secure channel. According to the authentication process, the remote certificate is invalid. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 9/30/2020, 01:45 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Cookie Compliance] Revert revert and fix the functional test" (#8236) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
When viewing dependencies on the web site for a package that targets .NET 5.0 the UI reads '.NETFramework 5.0' which I believe is incorrect.

### To Reproduce
Publish a package that targets .NET 5.0

### Expected behavior
Should display ".NET 5.0" instead of ".NETFramework 5.0"

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16097639/95006735-9f2d0e80-0607-11eb-8b15-d3be2f25a535.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fix Orchestrator runtime issue" (#8228) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Orchestrator fails with error:

```
Could not load file or assembly 'NuGet.Packaging.Core, Version=5.0.0.1, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.
```

Steps to be healthy:

* [x] Rollback orchestrator https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=829396
* [x] Update Gallery https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8229
* [x] Verify Gallery https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=833326
* [x] Publish NuGetGallery.Core https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=4116611&view=logs&j=fd490c07-0b22-5182-fac9-6d67fe1e939b&t=f03d4b0b-5c7f-5a3c-32ca-d79e6a87d689
* [x] Update Orchestrator's NuGetGallery.Core https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/pull/922
* [x] Verify Orchestrator DEV https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=833772

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Enable nuget.org to block packages with bad-formatted timestamps" (#8234) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Some third party TSA sent out timestamp without following encoding rules.
We have found several packages on nuget.org.
Pls refer to https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/issues/355 for more details.

### Describe the solution you'd like
We would like nuget.org to reject those packages.

### Additional context

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Status.NuGet.Org must not use meta refresh" (#7855) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
@ryuyu commented on [Thu Feb 27 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3018)

Currently, the status page uses a <meta> tag to cause the page to refresh.

This is not a11y compliant.
The page should be updated to use a javascript refresh instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update NuGet client libraries to 5.8.0 prerelease" (#8229) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The Gallery uses an older version of `NuGet.Packaging` that depends on `NuGet.Packaging.Core`. The Orchestrator was updated to use a newer version of `NuGet.Packaging` that no longer depends on `NuGet.Packaging.Core`. The Orchestrator uses assemblies produced from the Gallery, thereby causing runtime issues when these assemblies attempt to reference types from `NuGet.Packaging.Core.dll` which is unavailable.

Build: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=4116398&view=results
Release: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=833326

Part of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8228

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.VisualStudio.Internal.Contracts should use PublicAPIAnalyzers" (#10111) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: `NuGet.VisualStudio.Internal.Contracts` is not packed into a nupkg, and is entirely for NuGet's own internal use. However, it defines the over-the-wire contracts for Code Spaces (and Live Share?) scenarios. Therefore, backwards compatibility is still very important. Hence we should use PublicApiAnalyzers to minimise the risk that someone accidentally adds a breaking change.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget Debug verbosity should say where a package came from" (#3055) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
For debug purposes, it would be really useful if `restore -v Debug` said where a package came from. 

Useful information for a package that would be nice to have:
- whether it came from a local cache or server and the actual package path in either case
- the address of the feed it used for that package
- which Nuget.configs it took into consideration

Please read the following information before posting the issue.
https://openbullet.store
[openbullet](https://openbullet.store)
[openbullet download](https://openbullet.store)

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Warning ‚ÄòRestoreManagerPackage‚Äô package did not load correctly occurred and PM UI Menus disappeared when updating all packages for ASP.NET Web Single Page Application (.NET Framework)" (#10087) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Release-5.8.x\5.8.0.6873
VS Version: Main\30528.160
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps
1. Open VS and click ‚ÄúCreate a new project‚Äù button and click the template ‚ÄúASP.NET Web Application (.NET Framework)‚Äù.
2. Type the project name, click ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù button and create a ‚ÄúSingle Page Application‚Äù.
3. Open project PM UI, go to ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab, check ‚ÄúSelect all packages‚Äù check-box and click ‚ÄúUpdate‚Äù button.
4. Click ‚ÄúOK‚Äù button in the prompt ‚ÄúPreview Changes‚Äù window and click the ‚Äúrestart‚Äù button in PM UI.
## Expected
Updating is successful without any error.
## Actual
Warning ‚ÄòRestoreManagerPackage‚Äô package did not load correctly occurred and PM UI Menus disappeared as below screenshot. 
![RestorePackage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/94575966-660f3a00-02a7-11eb-91d7-c86ac2ba354c.JPG)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/94576328-cb632b00-02a7-11eb-9de4-7ca3802bdab1.png)
## Note
It started to repro from NuGet Dev\5.8.0.6865.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Static Nuspec not included when pack the project using a .csproj file" (#9788) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello guys,

Thanks in advance..

i have faced the issue in nuget pack generation by dotnet pack using .nuspec file.

I have scripts and styles in my project's wwwroot folder and nupec file for my project. These folder is shipped into the package as staticassets when i am run the command **`"dotnet pack ~/projects/app1/project.csproj"`**.

But my project's nuspec file not shipped in to pack. The packed content have default dotnet nuspec file.

Actual issue:

Local .nuspec not shipped in to package when we run **`"dotnet pack ~/projects/app1/project.csproj"`**. But wwwroot folder shipped as static assets. But my local nuspec file not included in generated nuget package

is this issue?

Can any one please help me on this?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The task factory "***" could not be found in the assembly "***"" (#10109) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I am trying to make nuget package with some task. But I ran into a problem:
`The task factory "NuGetLibrary.Tasks.MyTask" could not be found in the assembly "C:\Users\Den\.nuget\packages\nugetlibrary\2.0.0-alpha.637374840513886857\build\netstandard2.1\..\..\lib\netstandard2.1\NuGetLibrary.dll"`.

```
Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 Preview
Version 16.8.0 Preview 3.2
```

NuGetLibrary.nuspec
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<package xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2010/07/nuspec.xsd">
    <metadata>
        <id>NuGetLibrary</id>
        <version>2.0.0-alpha.$timestamp$</version>
        
        <owners>Den</owners>
        <authors>Den</authors>
        <title>NuGet Library</title>
        <icon>Icon.png</icon>
        <description>Example package</description>
        <tags></tags>
        <projectUrl>https://github.com/</projectUrl>
        <repository type="git" url="https://github.com/" />
        
        <developmentDependency>true</developmentDependency>
        <packageTypes>
            <packageType name="Dependency" />
        </packageTypes>

        <!--<frameworkReferences>
            <group targetFramework=".NETStandard">
            </group>
        </frameworkReferences>-->
        
        <!--<frameworkAssemblies>
        </frameworkAssemblies>-->
        
        <!--<dependencies>
            <group targetFramework=".NETStandard" >
                <dependency id="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Core" version="16.6.0" />
            </group>
        </dependencies>-->
        
        <!--<references>
            <group targetframework=".netstandard" >
            </group>
        </references>-->
        
        <contentFiles>
            <files include="**/*.*" buildAction="None" copyToOutput="false" flatten="false" />
        </contentFiles>
    </metadata>
    <files>
        <file src="Readme.txt" target="" />
        <file src="Icon.png" target="" />
        <file src="Build/NuGetLibrary.targets" target="build/netstandard2.1/" />
        <file src="bin/$configuration$/netstandard2.1/NuGetLibrary.dll" target="lib/netstandard2.1/" />
        <file src="bin/$configuration$/netstandard2.1/NuGetLibrary.pdb" target="lib/netstandard2.1/" />
        <file src="bin/$configuration$/netstandard2.1/NuGetLibrary.deps.json" target="lib/netstandard2.1/" />
        <file src="Content/Images/Image.jpg" target="contentFiles/any/netstandard2.1/Images/" />
    </files>
</package>
```

NuGetLibrary.targets
```
<Project xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
    <UsingTask TaskName="MyTask" AssemblyFile = "$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)..\..\lib\netstandard2.1\NuGetLibrary.dll" TaskFactory="NuGetLibrary.Tasks.MyTask" />
    <Target Name="BeforeBuild_" BeforeTargets="BeforeBuild">
        <Message Text="Hello World !!!" Importance="high" />
        <MyTask />
    </Target>
    <Target Name="AfterBuild_" AfterTargets="AfterBuild">
        <Message Text="Hello World !!!" Importance="high" />
        <MyTask />
    </Target>
</Project>
```

MyTask.cs
```
namespace NuGetLibrary.Tasks {
    using System;
    using System.Collections.Generic;
    using System.Text;
    using Microsoft.Build.Framework;
    using Microsoft.Build.Utilities;

    public class MyTask : Task {

        public override bool Execute() {
            Log.LogWarning( "MyTask !!!" );
            return true;
        }

    }
}
```
And the project itself.
[NuGetLibrary.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5326326/NuGetLibrary.zip)

What am I doing wrong?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fix 'dotnet pack' tests when testing under VS IDE" (#9996) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details

The NuGet Pack artifacts aren't being copied to the test SDK layout, when building/testing under VS IDE locally and not on CI/CLI. This was observed in PR NuGet/NuGet.Client#3270 as the changes were not reflecting in the tests leading to tests passing locally and failing on CI and vice-versa.

## Repro

1. Make some drastic changes to NuGet Pack targets (like delete the entire content)

2. Build and run tests.

3. Observe that tests do run successfully as the changed target files are not copied into test layout.

## Issue when implementing a Fix

It is straight forward to fix copying the pack assets to the test layout but the current implementation only copies `CoreCLR` assets for testing both the variants. There should be way to determine if the tests are running under Core MSBuild or Full MSBuild, so that we can efficiently test both type of project styles with the same tests. This is a blocker to enable tests on Full MSBuild (with non-sdk style projects) with the pack targets.
